description: I completed Norec’s one-week Preparatory Training in Kathmandu, Nepal, ahead of my professional exchange to Norway. The program, organized by Norec—a governmental body under the Norwegian Ministry of Foreign Affairs—focused on global understanding, intercultural communication, sustainable development, and the Norec model of mutual exchange. It brought together participants from organizations across Norway, Asia, Africa, and Latin America to prepare us for working and learning effectively in a new cultural and professional context.
Bachelor's degree with major in Bioinformatics and active involvement in technology management.
highlights: Travel award for computational biology conference

description: Specialized training in business and stakeholder management for international contexts.

After nearly a year of working in Norway with Zabai AS through the Norec exchange program, I attended Norec’s mandatory one-week Homecoming Training in Kathmandu, following a digital pre-training. The course focused on recognizing and reflecting on the results achieved and competences acquired during the exchange, and on how to communicate and apply these experiences back home. Through modules on communicating the exchange, identifying new learning, navigating the challenges and opportunities of returning, and thematic workshops, I developed a clearer plan for sharing my insights and contributing to my home organization.

degree: e-Learning Ecologies: Innovative Approaches to Teaching and Learning for the Digital Age
description: I completed a course on e-learning ecologies that explored how technology can genuinely transform, rather than simply digitize, education. It focused on seven key affordances—ubiquitous learning, active knowledge making, multimodal meaning, recursive feedback, collaborative intelligence, metacognition, and differentiated learning—and how these can be used to design effective, digitally rich learning experiences.

Successfully completed the first course in the Google Project Management Certificate, gaining foundational knowledge of project management concepts, terminology, and the project life cycle. The course covered core project manager responsibilities and skills, common methodologies, organizational structure and culture, and change management, helping to build readiness for entry-level project management roles across industries.

Completed the first course in the Google Cybersecurity Certificate, gaining an overview of the cybersecurity field, key threats, and their impact on organizations. The course covered core responsibilities and skills of entry-level cybersecurity analysts, the CISSP eight security domains, common security frameworks and controls, the CIA triad, security ethics, and commonly used analyst tools, building a foundation for pursuing entry-level roles in cybersecurity.
